name: Red Roof Inn West Springfield

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friends and I stayed here 2 nights during the Big E. Overall, for the price ($80 per night) it was OK. The main reason we picked Red Rood was that its 1 of 5 hotels the Big E shuttle stops at--and our first 2 choices were booked full.
reviews.title: Decent for Big E visitors

likes.liked: — The Big E shuttle stops here.
likes.disliked: — Located on a freary section of Riverdale St.

reviews.text: CLEANLINESS: The rooms appeared to be clean. There were a few gnats and a fly or 2 buzzing around our room. All 3 rooms we had booked had a bit of a stink to them--mostly stale cigarettes (all non-smoking rooms). And at least one person in every room complained about allergy-type problems the next morning (symptoms cleared after leaving the room),. We're convinved its due to the dirty a/c units each room had--which also contributed to the stink.
reviews.title: Enjoyed my stay

reviews.text: STAFF: No problems. No rude staff, even a few friendly hellos. I did try calling the front desk at 9am--no answer after 10-15 rings. Thats the only negative experience.
reviews.title: Nice place to stay
Clean, modern, great price
reviews.text: AREA: A sign in the lobby mentioned a problem with recent car break-ins. This isn't exactly a wam, welcoming area. But, what $80, right off the highway hotel is?

There are a ton of hotels and food options within 2 miles of the Red Roof. There are 3 restaurants adjacent to the hotel. We had drinks at "On The Border" a chain Mexican-themed place. I would NOT recommend Bickfords or B'Sharas (we had breakfast at both). Both places were extremely unorganized and the food was barely acceptable.
reviews.title: Good Deal

aka: Red Roof Inn West Springfield Hotel
